website_summaries.verdict: An exceedingly popular bait station for customers looking to eradicate in-home ant infestations.
pros: Designed to have the ants take the bait back to their colonies, making the bait extremely effective
Customers appreciated how quickly this product worked
cons: Station can get clogged from dead ants

customer_reviews.title: Killed 'em dead.
customer_reviews.text: Make a square of aluminum foil to place the trap on. After I figured out how to cut out the opening, I poured a small amount out on the foil to draw in the ants faster. Didn't take long. After a few days, no ants. You need a trap for each nest if you have ants in more than one place. So times you have ants from two different nests in the same room. That may take a little longer, be patient. The stuff will get them.
customer_reviews.author: P. Frank

customer_reviews.title: Deadly!!
customer_reviews.text: We had one of these left by our pest control company when we had a previous problem with ants. A couple of days ago we noticed ants (very tiny, don't know what kind) crawling around on our bathroom sink area. I remembered we had this product and put it out. It got scary because then we saw hundreds of ants making the journey try out this product. Next day.....zero ants and none since. So don't be alarmed if putting this out attracts even more ants because, in our case, they won't be back. I ordered this so we would have some on hand if ants ever reappear. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: mpowers

customer_reviews.title: No more Ant problem in the kitchen..
customer_reviews.text: These will ABSOLUTELY kill every ant colony that comes in contact with this thing...The ants are drawn to its juice like nothing I've seen, and then they bring it back to the nest, and they all die..Really quickly...I bought this to get rid of a colony of very small brown ants in my kitchen...The Ants were so small that they were having trouble even getting up the spout on this thing to get to the poison.. So I squeezed the gel out onto the counter in small globs...Within 10 minutes there were 100 ants on each glob going nuts....The next day? No more ants...And I havent seen one since. Problem solved with a great product. A++++
customer_reviews.author: Alfonso Dee

customer_reviews.title: all of the ants were dead and it seemed like they had all left
customer_reviews.text: This product really did get rid of my ant problem. The first day, when I set it out, the ants didn't even touch the product. So, I picked one of the ants up and put it on top of the bait station. When I got back from work, the swarm of ants were all over the bait station. I left the bait overnight and when I woke up, all of the ants were dead and it seemed like they had all left. No more ant problem after using this product.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Yang

customer_reviews.title: Works FASTER than the regular kind.
customer_reviews.text: Living in drought ridden California, I've had a huge problem with ants the last two summers and the recent humidity has made it worse. Within 90 minutes of placing these around the target areas in my kitchen, I saw ants swarming them. Two days later I've seen a massive reduction of ants in 5/6 areas I placed them in. I have one remaining problem area but there has been a reduction of ants. My mistake is that I should have placed more than one bait station there. I'm planning to order more and definitely recommend then. As for the lack of instructions, its pretty self explanatory.
customer_reviews.author: Melody C Arneil

customer_reviews.title: Great for those pesky little sugar ants
customer_reviews.text: This product is so reasonable. It is self contained. It really works. It appears safe. Can tuck it away under cabinets or in pantry. It works for those pesky little sugar ants. My exterminator charged me over $60 to come and put the identical item out. Shocked to find these so reasonable and readily available on Amazon! Thank you Amazon! This critters were gone in less than two days.
customer_reviews.author: SheShops

customer_reviews.title: Got the Job Done
customer_reviews.text: Works great! My room kept getting attacked by ants, whether it is was laundry, a spoon, or just searching for food, there were ants everywhere and I was sick of it. I placed 2 of these traps in the corners of my room and within two days, almost every ant had disappeared. It will take the ants awhile to find it (15-20 minutes) but after they do, they come swarming in, so make sure you put somewhere where you don't mind having trails of ants going to. My only problem is that I ordered this 6 pack but only 5 were sent, but I'm actually so impressed with this product that I'm not going to knock it down a star.
customer_reviews.author: Serendipity

customer_reviews.title: Works well for localized applications
customer_reviews.text: The ants immediately feed on the bait when introduced in their environment. They take it back to the nest to completely eradicate the colony in a week or so. The problem is a new colony will establish itself in a few months. I found that regularly spraying with talstar eliminates them completely. Do not get me wrong, this is a great ant bait. Just found a more cost effective solution for ants and many more pests around the house.
customer_reviews.author: SonnyK

customer_reviews.title: I'm pretty sure we're pulling in the "diners" from the surrounding ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work effectively... but the drawback is that ants beat a path to it -- a steady stream, in fact -- when it's full, empty, or when one hasn't been put down in its place for some weeks. (The trails persist, with or without the bait station placements.) Having been through lots of these trays, I'm pretty sure we're pulling in the "diners" from the surrounding acreage. (We live in the country.) If you could keep the word (and the trail) limited to our own pests, and not be pulling them in from miles away, as we seem to, I'd be willing to make this an easy 5-start rating. As it is, we'll go 3.5 to 4.
customer_reviews.author: Klaatu360

customer_reviews.title: The ants love the sweet liquid
customer_reviews.text: This works on just about any ants I've seen, from the small sugar ants to fire ants. They love the sweet liquid, so eat it and take it back to share. Bye-bye ants. It may take a day or two, but they do disappear. I keep these in my RV, for when we're traveling. Some places you park allow ants into the RV. If you try to find where they are coming in and place this near the entry point, they'll eat this instead and quit bugging you (I know - terrible pun). You can also use it as a preventative. Just be aware they will dry out after a few weeks, so need to be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Continuing the good fight
customer_reviews.text: These work inside. Just place them and forget them. One secret is once it is placed, leave it alone. Don't go moving it around. After several days check it and if there are a lot of dead ants inside it replace it with a fresh one. DO NOT try to empty it out and refill it. It seems like dead ants have an odor that the live ones know so they will avoid the trap. I keep one of these in an out of the way corner of the kitchen and check it a couple of times a week. I still see one or two ants, depending on the weather but no parades like before. Buy it again, absolutely.
customer_reviews.author: night player

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe at any speed?
customer_reviews.text: This product should be sold with proper instructions. As a possibly dangerous pesticide, it doesn't, plus, it just doesn't work. I noticed a lot of dead ants in the cat's water bowl shortly after putting these out {I thought it was supposed to track back to the queen?) but soon after the ants were back not quite in force, but still back. 2 months later -- Not only does this stuff not work, I am still plagued by ants -- but I have watched the ants pass the fluid from this by without even sampling it.
customer_reviews.author: RLSurfSandSun

customer_reviews.title: Carefull how you cut the opening to the packet.
customer_reviews.text: The traps work well. However you must be carefull how you cut the opening of the traps. The sticky bait can seep out. I had placed these on our kitchen counter tops behind objects. When i checked on them a few days later the fluid had pudled around the trap and was difficult to clean
customer_reviews.author: armchairGman

customer_reviews.title: THESE STOPPED A CONSTANT INFESTATION OF TINY ANTS! THEY DISAPPEARED INTO THE GREAT BEYOND! GONE!
customer_reviews.text: Here's the situation: THESE WORK! We were having infestations of tiny ants around our kitchen sink. If there was one grape, ten thousand of these tiny ants would march in like a brigade of warriors. I put out the ant baits, and BINGO, no more ants. It's like a miracle, truly. I'd been going crazy trying to stop the onslaught. This did the job. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail

customer_reviews.title: Never fails for sugar feeding ants
customer_reviews.text: Old Faithful for ants looking for carbs. You will need to source a protein based bait if this is not accepted within a day. Be sure not to over handle the stations as you will contaminate it. Soaps, cigarette smoke, perfume, are not enticers for ants. They communicate by pheromones and scents and its important, most people blow it. Wear gloves and minimize handling.
customer_reviews.author: OVERWATCH

customer_reviews.title: I wasn't quite sure this would work, since they ...
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't quite sure this would work, since they seemed to be able to get out, but it did eventually work. It was kind of creepy how it brought most of the ants out of hiding, so if you see that, don't panic. That's how it does it's job. It lures them out with the smell, I guess, then traps them in. Haven't had any ant problems since I used the one trap.
customer_reviews.author: AMZ Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works, Just as Advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I was noticing one or two ants at a time in my bathroom windowsill. After reading positive reviews, I purchased the Terro Liquid Ant Bait. Almost immedaitely, more ants began to appear. They were very attracted to it, just as advertised. After three days, it was full of ants, and no new ants were appearing. Just to be certain, I threw away the bait that I had used and put out a new one; however no more ants appeared. I would definitely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Canine Cohort

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what type of ants were invading my apartment, but this product completely eradicated them within a week. This is what I saw when I used the product. Days 1, 2: Influx of ants consuming the product. Day 3: Significantly less ants. A few stragglers are still eating the bait. Day 4: Only a couple ants are observed and they appear to be weak. Some of them fall down while climbing. Day 5: Not a single ant is found.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Finally something that WORKS!!!
customer_reviews.text: Product has changed my life. I live in a severely ant-infested community. I had tried all different baits, sprays, and even had professionals come out to spray and it did nothing to improve my ant situation. My ants FLOCK to these bates and are completely gone/dead within days. I initially used about 4 around the house. They stayed gone for about 4-6 months then started to trickle in, and usually one bait takes care of them in small volumes.
customer_reviews.author: Traci

customer_reviews.title: Description on Amazon says pet safe, box says otherwise. NOT HAPPY.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because it said pet safe. I received the product and it specifically states not to place it anywhere that pets can get to it. How is it pet safe if it can't be around pets? I own cats and they can basically get into every crevice and area of my house if they really want to. I'm extremely annoyed by this and have no clue if I can even use the product now.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa C

customer_reviews.title: Worked well!
customer_reviews.text: I had some sugar ants in my sunroom that were very annoying. I bought Terro Ant Killer and it did the trick. Placed in some corners of the room, it killed a ton of ants. Some must have made it back to the nest because the ants have totally disappeared. Be careful if you pick up the container because the liquid can spill out easily. That's my only complaint about the product. I ended up spilling over my floor and had a sticky mess to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: CabushkaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Gets rid of the ants!
customer_reviews.text: Each Spring, the ants pay us a visit. No matter what I do--spray, dust, scream, kill them and leave the bodies for their buddies to see, I couldn't get rid of them. Put a few of these across their path and you'll be freaked out! Within hours, the ants are crawling all over it. A few days later, the ants are GONE! I put these out in the kitchen this Spring and haven't seen a single ant in the kitchen since. Did the same thing near the front door and I laughed as they gorged themselves on the fluid in the baits. Try them.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Effective
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my office years ago. We still have a few left because it only takes one every spring to solve our ant problem. Works within a day or two. I wonder if those reviewers complaining the ants just walk all over the bait stations have OPENED the stations so that the ants can access the poison. Also, you have to leave it for a couple of days at least. Try not to move it or disturb the ant trail.
customer_reviews.author: Merry Mac

customer_reviews.title: Definitely would recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: I was tempted to deduct a star for lack of instructions which I find completely irresponsible but it works so well! I laid out two traps, one in each area I saw ant activity. Yes, wear gloves and hold with the end you cut up. I saw increased activity over the next 24 hrs, then a few stragglers in the next 24hrs...then nothing! Not a single ant in the last full day. Very impressed and I have 4 traps left just in case a new queen moves in. Definitely would recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: K. Barlow

customer_reviews.title: Illegally repackaged product
customer_reviews.text: Illegally repackaged from a larger box. Arrived in a ziplock with no instructions in clear violation of the product's labeling and Federal regulations governing this product.
customer_reviews.author: Angry Bald Guy

customer_reviews.title: Works quickly and lasts for months.
customer_reviews.text: It took me over a year, but I've finally gone through my initial order of this ant bait. Anytime there was an invasion I set out a packet in a place near the action but away from our pets. Two days later, all ants are gone - for months! Will buy again without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Tallred

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: These things are little packages of magic. We've been swarmed with ants every night for the last few summers. I've tried sprays, gels and traps, and none of them work for more than a day. When I bought a pack of these about a month ago I put one in each ant conga line in the morning. Within half an hour both of them were completely covered with the little pests, with a thick line of new ones coming for the bait. By the next morning, there was no line, just a few stragglers, and by that night, no new activity. I haven't seen a single ant since. Not one.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Best ever for sugar ants
customer_reviews.text: After spending 100s of dollars on an exterminator for well over a year, the sugar/ghost ants were still EVERYWHERE. I put 3 of these down in our main problem area and the ants were immediately feeding on them. I saw virtually no ants within 12 hours and none within 48 hours. I also bought the terro outdoor liquid ant baits but I haven't put them out yet (plan to today).
customer_reviews.author: Miamimom

customer_reviews.title: Kills Ants - but has liquid that can flow out
customer_reviews.text: Kills ants. Period. Cut off the red part of the package and it makes a nive little ramp for the them. They take the poison back to their colony. It can be set down indoors or out. In about 2 days we had no ant problem. I use mine outside because of my two cats. There is liquid in these things and if batted by a curious cat, could go all over the floor and them.
customer_reviews.author: Nineseas

customer_reviews.title: Bugs Be Gone!
customer_reviews.text: We've battled these tiny ant like creatures for months, in the kitchen. They came out in mass, when anything was spilled on the the counter. Put two of these traps out and two days later, the whole colony must be dead! We haven't seen a single straggler!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best ant killer around. I used several Raid products, to no avail. Just one of these traps will get rid of the ants within 2-5 days. Initially it attracts even MORE ants and can be intimidating. But wait it out. Don't kill the ants it attracts - those are the carriers of the poison back to the colony. After the initial frenzy to the traps, the ants quickly vanish. This is the only ant product I will buy from here on out.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Ant Killer: Liquid Ant Bait Station - Pack of 6 - Terro - PCO
customer_reviews.text: My Pest Control people used these when my kitchen window was riddled with incoming troops of worker summer ants. THESE ARE FANTASTIC and I didn't know I could purchase them without calling a Pest Control Company. They are awesome and do the trick within a week. I'll be back and bought extra to keep on hand. It's recommended to replace traps every few months. Thanks for the SPEEDY service to get rid of my icky kitchen ant problem. Even though they are small. The heat gets cooking outside and they start to come in my kitchen window.
customer_reviews.author: picksnfinds

customer_reviews.title: ANTS LOVE THIS!!!
customer_reviews.text: The ants love this bait more that anything they used to go after in my kitchen. I used 3 in the exact same area at one time, which was dumb. Then I used one in shed where my cookies and junk food are kept, then one in room where kitty eats, and 6th one is in kitchen still with lots of ants. I ordered 6 more, but won't use 3 at once in same space.
customer_reviews.author: Boot Fan

customer_reviews.title: Eradicate your ants!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works. I recently got sod installed and with it came an abundance of ant intruders into my house. We initially bought a cheap store brand ant trap and the ants just seemed to laugh at it. Some days we'd count over 100 ants roaming around. I bought these on Amazon after reading the reviews. Within 2-3 days the ants were wiped out and never seen again. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Extremely effective.
customer_reviews.text: I eat in my bedroom. What can I say, I'm a slob. I started to see ants on my computer desk as I worked. I think they were scouts since it hasn't become too bad yet. Got this product and put it around my room. 24 hours later, they had many ants in them and there was no more ants in the room. That was in the last week of June or first week of July 2016 and I'm writing this on July 15tj.
customer_reviews.author: Barzins

customer_reviews.title: Packaged very well.
customer_reviews.text: This product recommended to our office for ants and they were not kidding when they say it kills right away. We put the baits down and the very next morning when came in to NO ants. They have not been back and it has been well over 2 months. So we now swear by this product.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda H.

customer_reviews.title: Ants come from everywhere for this buffet. I noticed ...
customer_reviews.text: Ants come from everywhere for this buffet. I noticed some small ants on my counter one morning, I put this out, jumped in the shower, came out and there was a buffet going on. Next day not one single ant was seen and haven't seen any in over a month. I had another area that took more time but again even after they ate it for a week...no sign of ants since. Second year buying these...
customer_reviews.author: C C

customer_reviews.title: It arrived on time, but
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived on time in a bubble wrap bag. The problem was the traps were not in a carton in the bubble wrap bag. They were loose. On each trap are the directions to to look at the carton for instructions on how to use the traps. Since they did not come in their original carton I am without instructions on how to use them. The three star rating has nothing to do with the effectiveness of the product. I will know more about that after I figure out how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Best Ant Killer I Have Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: I have battled ants on and off for years. I've used everything I could get my hands on; the products would get most, but not all of them. This product killed them all in 24 hours! I haven't seen an ant in a week! This is a first. In my opinion, you won't go wrong if you use this.
customer_reviews.author: Shevawn

customer_reviews.title: This stuff really kills ants!
customer_reviews.text: Best stuff ever for Texas Rasberry Ants! Killed those suckers in less than 12 hours. On my counters one night and gone by the morning. And I mean gone!
customer_reviews.author: B. Tungate

customer_reviews.title: We put these out and it was like ringing the dinner bell as all the ants swarmed ...
customer_reviews.text: We used another brand and the ants completely ignored the traps. We put these out and it was like ringing the dinner bell as all the ants swarmed the traps and 100% solved the problem within one day. After a few days pick up the traps with a paper towel and carefully dispose of the traps in a sealed plastic bag to be safe.
customer_reviews.author: Seth DC

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Effective Ant Killer
customer_reviews.text: After a month long attempt to rid my kitchen of an explosion of tiny ants using all the "household" methods, I bought these. Not wanting to use chemicals with our cats in the house, I put one little bait station way back by the stove. Thinking that if one helped at all, I would put out more traps in safe locations. After the first day, there were only a few ants in sight and all were gone before the end of the second day. This stuff is amazing - IT REALLY WORKS!!
customer_reviews.author: PLC Cuyahoga Falls

customer_reviews.title: Product Worked/Packaging Not so Great
customer_reviews.text: These worked well. It took a couple days until I didn't see any ants on my counter or in the closet. I don't think I'd ever have found the nest so I needed something that could be in a cabinet or on a couter. The packaging was not super. My 6 traps came in a plastic bag and one of them had leaked a bit so everything was sticky. They show it as in a box but not mine!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its chemicals but I did notice it did help finish ...
customer_reviews.text: Its chemicals but I did notice it did help finish off the ant colony we'd been dealing with and I had been using all kinds of stuff with varying results
customer_reviews.author: peace

customer_reviews.title: Impressive!
customer_reviews.text: Upon moving into a new apartment, I was unhappy to find tiny black ants in the bedrooms, bathrooms and garage. I cut open the first bait over my bathroom sink in case of a leak (a good idea, by the way as they tend to dribble) and carried it downstairs to put in my garage. By the time I returned -- all of three minutes later -- a previously ant-free bathroom counter top had a trail into the bathroom sink where a tiny amount of the bait had leaked when I cut off the top. A good omen for the end of my ant problem.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Advertised as "Pet Safe" But it is Not
customer_reviews.text: The description of this product says "Pet Safe: Yes" but the instructions say "Place bait in areas inaccessible to children and pets." The active ingredient is Borax, which many sources say is toxic to cats and dogs. I have several cats, so needless to say I will not be using this. Amazon should revise the description to make it clear that this product should not be used where children and pets can get to it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: This works for sugar ants
customer_reviews.text: This works the best of all I have tried. I am getting another batch for 2019
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It freaking worked!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm speechless. It worked like a charm. First day or two, the ants started to disappear. After a week, no sign of a single ant. It's been close to a month and no ants in sight. I highly recommend this because it works. Plus the dispenser is self contained and the extras will probably be good to use for next year.
customer_reviews.author: TheAmazonPrime

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was first given one of these by my exterminator and I am so grateful! I have little "piss ants" in my kitchen every summer and nothing gets rid of them except this. All I do is set one of these out and in a week, no more ants for the rest of the season! I think the ants take this product back to the queen which kills the entire nest but I'm not sure. Either way, all I know is that I don't have to deal with these annoying little critters all over my counters and in my food. I think this is the best product ever for getting rid of those little ants!
customer_reviews.author: Robin Lane

customer_reviews.title: It works!!!!!! they flock to it ~
customer_reviews.text: Im amazed something actually works! put this in an area where you dont mind ants to be~ i live in the country and every spring and summer ants come in and there is NOTHING you can do to keep them away! I will wake up with ant on my counters just hanging out.. its insane! i swear this old ranch house is built on an ant hill.... i was given this to try and put it in my window sill to try and i dont have any more ants in my kitchen at all! they go to that thing like its candy!!! and they die! LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Renee Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Some of the best ant killer i've used
customer_reviews.text: Some of the best ant killer i've used. It'll take a day or so of ants gorging themselves on it. Usually at my place i'll get an ant trail and they'll dig into the Terro stuff for a day or two, then i'll just notice i dont have ants at all anymore. They absolutely love the stuff and it works great. Just make sure and put a little something over the top so pets dont get into it and you're golden.
customer_reviews.author: The President of the Universe

customer_reviews.title: Ants can't seem to resist
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these traps when we noticed ants around the outside of our house and a few ants inside. Placed a few outside where they would be under at least partial cover and a few more inside where the ants seemed to be entering the house. The ants were drawn to the traps very quickly and after a few days I noticed there were no more ants forming trails along the spots I had noticed before. Very satisfied with the speed and efficacy of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: It really works
customer_reviews.text: I recommend this product!! It really works! We always had a problems with ants but this winter they were all over, we tried everything they sell at the store and didn't help. As soon as I placed one of these in the kitchen they were gone! They tried coming back in the laundry room but placed another feeder there and I have only seen a few! It has only been 5 days and no sign of ants anymore !
customer_reviews.author: Ardvisura

customer_reviews.title: Works better than anything I've ever used prior
customer_reviews.text: I tried these last year, and they work better than anything I have ever seen! Every spring we get ants, I purchase this product, and with in no time, we have no more ants! I have recommended this product to several of my friends, who report the same results! It's very simple: if you have unwanted ants in your home, purchase these bait traps and they will be gone within a week!
customer_reviews.author: ViciousGnome

customer_reviews.title: Cleared up hundreds of ants in 3 days
customer_reviews.text: We placed three traps in the kitchen and three in the bathroom, the two places where we saw the most ants. Within two hours a steady stream of ants was travelling to the traps. Once we knew exactly where the ants were coming from we re-positioned the traps to make their trip as short as possible. Within three days all ants were gone and a couple of months later we haven't seen a single ant.
customer_reviews.author: Artur Grabowski

customer_reviews.title: It Works, Kills the Ants
customer_reviews.text: It's ant killer and it does kill the ants. If you have ants, buy this. It works. I used to have Petris come and spray and I eventually cancelled that service. They used to use this product and leave me some extras. Now if I see any ants, I put one or two of these out and the ants are gone within a couple of days.
customer_reviews.author: JRA

customer_reviews.title: Ants pounced immediately.
customer_reviews.text: Just received the product and immediately set it in the laundry room where I have seen ants often. There are dozens of ants currently eating the liquid and they are hopefully taking it back to their nest as others are heading to the poison. Hopefully that queen bitch will eat the poison and die. We'll have to wait a few weeks to see the results.
customer_reviews.author: lali77

customer_reviews.title: WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: We used to have a contract with an insect terminator for our house but we cancelled. They put these stations around the house to kill ants. But they would come back after a while so I went to Amazon and found one can buy them here for a whole lot less money then it is to have a professional do it for us. Anyhow, I set these where the ants are and in a few days I no longer see them! Nice! No spray, no odor...works well for us.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra K. Miller

customer_reviews.title: This is my go to bait for indoor control.
customer_reviews.text: This will be the 3rd time I've picked up this item to solve my occasional incursion by the pesky ants in 3-4 years. It usually works overnight and no sign of them by the next afternoon! I place 1 or 2 in key locations depending on ant trails. I will re-purchase this when needed and have recommended it to others.
customer_reviews.author: windzor

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful.
customer_reviews.text: I was being driven crazy by those sugar ants. In desperation after trying so many things, I ordered the Terro ant baits. They really worked and fast. Wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not full product as shown. Does not come with box or instructions
customer_reviews.text: I was very dissappointed to receive the item with no package. The item says read package for instructions and it's not self explanatory how to set it up. This seems like they illegally re-sold part of a larger package of these to make more of a profit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really effective, not very toxic. Thumbs up.
customer_reviews.text: I used these on the ants in my kitchen and outside around my trash. In both places, the ants were gone with 3 days (colony killed). I love that these are natural BORAX and not as toxic as most chemical (with kids and pets around!). The only drawback is that when you snip the end open so the ants can crawl in, sometimes the poison goo leaks out. Not too big a deal since it isn't that toxic, but the design could be better. While these say they are only for indoor use, I used them outdoor just fine. Just remember to pick them up again after a week or so.
customer_reviews.author: Summer Days

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend and buy again if I ever needed too
customer_reviews.text: this really works, I had "sugar" ants in my kitchen cupboard, after throwing everything away that they could get into, I cleaned the cupboard and purchased these ant baits, put one into the cupboard and WOW all the ants came after it, I left it in there for two days, all the ants are GONE and I am thrilled to say I have not seen any since. I would recommend and buy again if I ever needed too.
customer_reviews.author: Linda M. Tatro

customer_reviews.title: They work!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several different brands of ant traps. These are less convenient to use then dry traps, but the Terro liquid bait stations are the best in controlling ants. You need to check them periodically to make sure they still have liquid bait but a 6-pack might last a year. We still see an occasional ant but never the hoards that previously appeared.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Craig

customer_reviews.title: Terro -PCO
customer_reviews.text: I could be wrong but it seems the company is making the product more fluid than before, meaning once the container is open the product can run from the container. It is difficult an annoying to clean it once it is on the floor. This never happened before, as i had used the product many times. Still a good product doing it's job with the ants.
customer_reviews.author: Myron Roth

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived promptly and was exactly as advertised. I will order again if needed for the future
customer_reviews.author: Mike Antonetti

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product! Laid one trap down in the path ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product! Laid one trap down in the path the ants were taking, and within hours the trails to the other places they were moving to disappeared! I had used another brand of ant trap and that barely did anything. THIS is the real deal! **Shipment arrives in a plastic sack, not in the box in the photo.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: I'd like to have the carton with directions
customer_reviews.text: Mine came without a box. Label says "see outer carton for complete directions" but I didn't get the outer carton. I got 6 units in a plastic bag. Anyway, I cut open and poured one on a paper plate and the ants eat it and went away. If I were to reorder, I'd like to have the carton with directions!
customer_reviews.author: S. Reid

customer_reviews.title: I am glad I have my kitchen back
customer_reviews.text: I have tried everything in the book trying to get rid of the ants in my kitchen and in three days they were gone. but I have left the bait out just in case. Those ants was all over the bait Those pest can get into the tinniest hole and no way can spray get to them. I am glad I have my kitchen back.
customer_reviews.author: gg

customer_reviews.title: Worked for us!
customer_reviews.text: We used these last year around the house. I put most of them outside because I had a toddler running around (who did end up sticking one in his mouth but thankfully these are non-toxic for children!). The ants disappeared and our house is so far clear this year despite other people already having ants. I'm back to buy more just in case they surface again.
customer_reviews.author: kelbel

customer_reviews.title: The Ants do love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: This product does work however plan on buying a spring, summer and fall supply hence the 4 stars (we get plenty of cold weather in the winter). I do not know, however, how many ant hills I am dealing with so there is that to consider. :)
customer_reviews.author: B.Kolar

customer_reviews.title: It's a Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product several times over the years and it works where nothing else did. I had ants coming out of the cracks onto my kitchen counter. After putting out 3 Terro containers, I noticed the ants were drawn to them fairly quick. Within a few days the numbers were diminishing and finally no ants.
customer_reviews.author: T Frasier

customer_reviews.title: I will be ordering a bunch more this summer
customer_reviews.text: I have read the reviews from people who didn't have any luck with this type of ant product. I can say that for me here in NM, with the tiny black sugar ants these work really well.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Good but spend more and get the ones that kill the queen and colony
customer_reviews.text: I found better at the dollor store that kills the queen, but these do well at controlling ants and do there job well for the cost. This is why I only took one star away.
customer_reviews.author: steven caudill

customer_reviews.title: Worked as well as expected. Placed trap where I ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked as well as expected. Placed trap where I saw ants and then saw them staggering the next day. No longer have ants!
customer_reviews.author: John A!!

customer_reviews.title: Must have worked.
customer_reviews.text: Put this out along with two other and killers one did the job or all three.
customer_reviews.author: sandman

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you need
customer_reviews.text: I have ant problems for years when it starts getting warm outside. 2 areas were a problem. But 1 own in both places. In 4 days both were empty. Put another one down in both places. Before they were finished the ants had disappeared.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Not effective
customer_reviews.text: I had hordes of ants. Not very many headed for these traps. I even squirted some of the liquid up towards the opening, to help them along. Not an effective solution. Messy, too.
customer_reviews.author: miss critique

customer_reviews.title: These are great.  My professional pest service uses them.
customer_reviews.text: These are great. My professional pest service uses them. Be aware they can leave a sticky trail, so watch where you place them.
customer_reviews.author: BettyBoop

customer_reviews.title: Killed most of the ants, but not all
customer_reviews.text: While this did kill a lot of ants, it didn't kill them all. There were still some crawling around after but not nearly as many. It is easier and cleaner to put down than other types of ant poison. Takes a day or two to start working.
customer_reviews.author: George Jefferson

customer_reviews.title: I feel its the best stuff around without spraying chemicals everywhere that only kill ...
customer_reviews.text: Been using this product for years. I feel its the best stuff around without spraying chemicals everywhere that only kill on contact. This stuff eliminates the colony, just give it time ( a day or two ) and the price is great!
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: this product came in a clear plastic bag not the ...
customer_reviews.text: this product came in a clear plastic bag not the box that you see in the picture.. it had no instructions.. at first i thought ok, now how does this work.. had to go online and find instructions... very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast attraction!
customer_reviews.text: Ants were attracted very quickly. At first one or two were crawling around but within 20 minutes there were dozens feasting. The only problem is the liquid leaks out. I was sure that all the liquid was on the bottom while held vertical before I cut the end but after sitting horizontally for a half hour I noticed a puddle. Maybe the floor isn't level.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Catalano

customer_reviews.title: These work pretty well at getting rid of anys
customer_reviews.text: These work pretty well at getting rid of anys. Remember that you will see more at first, but then they will go away. My issue is, I'm not sure if I'm cutting these open wrong or what, but they always end up leaking all over whatever surface they're on and making a horrible mess.
customer_reviews.author: RZK

customer_reviews.title: Took care of our ant problem in 48 hours!
customer_reviews.text: We set up one trap for ants in our kitchen and overnight the majority of ants had met their demise. Within 2 hours of setting out the bait ants started trickling in and 8-12 hours it was rush hour traffic but by 48 hours there were no more ants!! Highly recommend this product and it is worth the extra cost over the stuff offered at most big box retail stores!
customer_reviews.author: Kak

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! This definitely does what it says! I put one trap down where i saw a colony of ants and the next day they were all completely gone!! Truly a great product!!
customer_reviews.author: Monesha Douglas

customer_reviews.title: I didn't even know it was this bad until my husband place a few out
customer_reviews.text: Got these today, I have ants, ants and more ants. Marching 2 by 2 for the baits. I didn't even know it was this bad until my husband place a few out. I'm going to be seeing ants in my sleep tonight, hopefully I wont see them when I wake up! To Be Continued...
customer_reviews.author: Louis G

customer_reviews.title: This stuff really works. Within a week I didn't ...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff really works. Within a week I didn't see ants. As soon as it was dried out ants came back, so I put another out and once agin the ants were gone.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: kills sugar ants for sure
customer_reviews.text: works but don't move it around or the goo that works will make a sticky situation... the accidental sticky you will learn to avoid sure kills those invading sugar ants we have in the South.
customer_reviews.author: Burnham

customer_reviews.title: We've been battling ants for awhile, but we put ...
customer_reviews.text: We've been battling ants for awhile, but we put this down and they all came out for about 12 hours and within 24 for back in the colony dead. Its been a week and we haven't seen a single ant. Plus I only used 1 of the 6 packs.
customer_reviews.author: lovetoread

customer_reviews.title: So effective I sent another pack to daughter
customer_reviews.text: Being invaded by small ants in my bathroom where it was warm & moist I was wanting a safe and effective product that SAID it was safe for animals. When the package arrived the literature inside had the same cautions as others "Keep out of reach of children & pets." But because animals do not frequent the bathroom I did find the ant bait stations effective when used.
customer_reviews.author: Sparklebauble

customer_reviews.title: so good. I only saw a handful of ants in ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. I only saw a handful of ants in one place. After having this bait out for a couple of weeks I don't see ants anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Ant-tastic bait station
customer_reviews.text: We'd gone through a number of mediocre, supermarket-bought ant control options, with almost no luck — to the point that we decided to call in a professional. Over the phone, the exterminator candidly told me that he'd be happy to come out and estimate the job for me, but instead recommended that we buy a pack of these bait stations. Success! Ants teemed in to grab the liquid bait, and within 3-4 days we had the problem under control. Highly recommended for persistent ant problems!
customer_reviews.author: M. Swift

customer_reviews.title: Terro liquid ant bait works great!
customer_reviews.text: We bought several regular ant traps at the grocery store, and the ants wouldn't go near them. They love these and so do we. We have placed them in areas out of our way, and since using Terro, the ants leave everything else alone. Hopefully they are taking the goodies back to the nest to share, and our ant problem will be no more.
customer_reviews.author: Pawsibilities

customer_reviews.title: too easy to spill if kicked or knocked over
customer_reviews.text: Works for a while, too easy to spill if kicked or knocked over.
customer_reviews.author: blindpro

customer_reviews.title: Used these in the kitchen the day I noticed an ...
customer_reviews.text: Used these in the kitchen the day I noticed an ant trail. They were gone in a day with no clean up!
customer_reviews.author: Michell Thompson

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works! With all the millions of ants ...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works! With all the millions of ants that find their way into our house and office, this I have found to work quickly on getting rid of them and keeping them away. You have to replace every 4 weeks or so once they start turning into a solid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ant bait that really attracts the ants
customer_reviews.text: We put these out and the ants really go for them. Now we hope they will kill off the ants. They really attract the ants for sure!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kandi and Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good Safe Product
customer_reviews.text: The first ones were given to me by the exterminator for an ant problem - good safe product
customer_reviews.author: Sue Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Effect is moderate, Did not kill the entire colony as I wished.
customer_reviews.text: I left 3 "pet safe" liquid ant bait stations out for almost 2 weeks around two main ant trails. But I still see ants crawling around my house today. I would say, it did kill some crazy worker ants but did not kill the queen as I wished. The colony is still hidden somewhere near our apartment. I was not completely satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jolene w

product_meta.title: Ant Killer: Liquid Ant Bait Station 0.36 oz - Pack of 6 - Terro-PCO
product_meta.description: Size:eachTerro-PCO is a liquid borate bait that instantly attracts and kills ants and their colonies. Terro-PCO is easy to use, has no unpleasant odors, may be used indoors and outdoors, and comes ready to use in pre-filled bait station-- this means no drips, spills, or messes. Ants will come to the bait station, enter, feed and then return to the colony to share the bait and therefore spreading the active ingredient to others. Terro-PCO is also a green pesticide that is safe around people and pets. Terro-PCO is a liquid borate bait that instantly attracts and kills ants and their colonies. Terro-PCO is easy to use, has no unpleasant odors, may be used indoors and outdoors, comes ready to use in pre-filled bait station-this means no drips, spills, or messes. Ants will come to the bait station, enter, feed and then return to the colony to share the bait, therefore spreading the active ingredient to others. Terro-PCO is also a "green" pesticide that can be used in Green Pest Management programs. As a borate-based product, Terro-PCO has a very minimal mammalian toxicity and targets specific pests. This reduces the repercussions on people, pets and non-target insects helpful to the environment (such as butterflies and honeybees). Also, Terro-PCO is applied only where needed, further reducing any unnecessary impact to the rest of the environment. And since it is long-lasting, less product is required for a successful and effective Green Pest Management program. How do I use the Terro PCO Ant Bait Stations? Place baits, label side up, near ant trails or close to where ants are numerous. Place additional baits anywhere ants may enter the home. For best results, use seven baits to ensure sufficient supply for the ants. Monitor regularly for activity but do not interfere with the natural behavior of ants. Replace with additional baits when first set is depleted. Once ants are controlled, replace baits every three months to keep ants from returning.
feature_bullets: Higher active ingredient than other Terro and ant bait products - 5% vs. 2%

Target pests: Argentine ants, Ghost ants, Cornfield ants, Pavement ants, Acrobat ants, White-footed ants, Little black ants, Odorous house ants, Crazy ants, Big-headed ants and other sweet-eating ants.
For use in: Homes, Hospitals, Restaurants, Apartments, Grocery Stores, Institutional Buildings, Schools, Cafeterias, Warehouses and more. Pet safe: Yes.
Same ant control traps used by Professionals and Exterminators.
